text: absolutely nothing bone-chilling about
the weather this Halloween it's been
warm hellishly warm record-breaking ly
warm temperatures have been over 20
Celsius widely across the UK a spooky 24
across the southeast the warmest
Halloween on record and up and down the
land the lanterns have been lit by those
temperatures being a few degrees above
the average for the end of October and
if you're heading out this evening well
it's still gonna be eerily spookily mild
out there and a dry evening too if you
are heading out trick-or-treating for
most but not everywhere like an invading
army of zombies the rain trickling its
way into western scott and western
fringes of wales but clearing from
northern ireland many central and
eastern areas will stay dry and fine and
yes it's still pretty mild out there
